The Candrakiraṇa

Digital Edition of Candrakiraṇa

edited by Zakariya Pamuji Aminullah

Current Version: , 2022-06-15Z
Still in progress – do not quote without permission.
  • Witnesses
  • Metadata

List of Witnesses

  • : Perpustakaan Nasional Republik Indonesia, Jakarta, Lontar, L631
    • : Perpustakaan Nasional Republik Indonesia, Jakarta, Lontar, L298
      • : Perpustakaan Nasional Republik Indonesia, Jakarta, Lontar, L241
        • : Pusat Dokumentasi Dinas Kebudayaan Provinsi Bali, Bali, Lontar, K/I/2/DOKBUD
          • Content:
            • Aji Canda
          • Colophon:
          • : Leiden University, Leiden, Leiden University Libraries, Or 11.185
            • Content:
              • Aji Canda
            • Colophon:
              • iti aji canda samapta. Oṁ dirgayurastu tatastu astu.

          Metadata of the Edition

          • Title: The Candrakiraṇa. Digital Edition of Candrakiraṇa
          • Text Identifier: DHARMA_CritEdCandrakirana
          • Edited by Zakariya Pamuji Aminullah
          • Copyright © 2019-2025 by Zakariya Pamuji Aminullah.

          This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

          invocation

          J2:1rB1:1vB2:1v om̐ avighnam astu(1)

          1.

          Introduction

          kiraṇo(2) vyaktiś(3) candrāgneḥ(4), dvijānāṁ kavir(5) uttamaḥ(6).

          1.1

          nahan byakta pinakaśarīra bhaṭāra, milvājanmāgave(7) bhuvana, sira tāṣṭatanu(8) ṅaranira, sira tāṣṭadeśomidәr(9) pinakavәṅku, sira ta(10) huripnikaṅ rāt, sira dumadyakәn vr̥ddhiniṅ janma kabeh, prāṇaprāṇī sarva hurip, ikanaṅ urip lavan avak, śarīra pamisanya riṅ sādhārādheya(11), gumavay ikaṅ sarva dadi, sira sinaṅguh pūrvaniṅ janma.

          Translation

          No translation available yet for this part of the edition DHARMA_CritEdCandrakirana

          1.2

          umijil taṅ aṣṭatanu riṅ rat, nara, paśu, mr̥ga(12), janma, sthāvara(13), pakṣi, sarīsr̥pa, mīna(14), prabhavaniṅ(15) ādhārādheya

          Parallels
            nara, paśu, mr̥ga, janma, sthāvara, pakṣi, sarīsr̥pa, mīna
          • BrP73.14 mānuṣa paśu mr̥ga sarīsr̥pa pakṣi sthāvara.
          Translation

          No translation available yet for this part of the edition DHARMA_CritEdCandrakirana

          1.3

          prabhu rāma r̥ṣi, tiga sira, pramāṇa riṅ rat, pakə̄niṅ(16) bhuvana, tuvi sira tunduk apeśīki(17), guruniṅ janma kabeh, lvirnira irikaṅ(18) chandanira(19), ṅkāna sira tika siddhaguru, sira tāṣṭagaṇa(20) guṇanira(21) gumavayB2:2r ikaṅ varta sәk lumrā.

          Translation

          No translation available yet for this part of the edition DHARMA_CritEdCandrakirana

          2.

          Origin of the kakavin meters

          2. Pādānuṣṭubh

          ikaṅ akṣaropamāvak(22), ika ta guru ṅaranya, yeki ta vinastu(23) hurip, ya sinaṅguh guru laghu. 1

          ya pinakamūla(24) chanda, avaknikaṅ(25) guru laghu, lavan hurip masaṅyoga(26), umijil tikaṅ trigaṇa(27). 2

          adәgnikaṅ guru laghu, aniga-nigeṅ sagaṇa(28), yekāṣṭagaṇa(29) ṅaranya, sama tāvyāpāre vr̥tta(30). 3
          [line 1] mvaṅ laku śloka nihan len(31).

          3.

          Long syllabes

          3. Śārdūlavikrīḍita:  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          sakveh saṅ sujanātiharṣa(32) irikaṅ(33) chandā nihan kavruhi(34), yan maJ2:1vhyun vruha rūpaniṅ laghu lavan tekā(35) sinaṅguh guru, bhedanyaṅ(36) guru lāghu(37) yeṅәtakәna mvaṅ huṅgvaniṅ hakṣara(38), sakvehniṅ guru yeriṅәn(39) hila-hilekā(40) yan salah kasthānan(41).1

          bhyaktāniṅ guru sarva(42) dīrgha(43) taruṅā saṅyogapārānәṅәn, lāvan(44) karṇa visarja kāni śurahan(45) svārāṅ(46) vatәk vyañjana(47), e ai nāhan(48) anuṅ(49) kayatnakәna(50) len o au(51) vәkasniṅ(52) guru, vus meṅәt pva kiterikā(53) niyata yan sotanta(54) dadyā(55) vacan. 2

          lvirniṅ hakṣara(56) gantuṅәn mapakәneṅ(57) vaktā(58) mvaṅ aṅgantuṅa, saṅyogāpara(59) sūkṣma(60) lakṣmaṇa(61) śivāgni kleśa lakṣmī(62) kunaṅ, ndan(63) glāna(64) sthula nagna(65) vighna mamәvә̄(66) nirvighna māra(67) sthiti, svapna sneha rikaṅ dvitīya(68) kahaḍaṅ riṅ dlāha(69) yan pāphala(70). 3

          vahniṅ(71) tīkṣṇa(72) murub riṅ adri(73) ya katon raśminya(74) sāteja(75) ya, *masnāna(76) pva kiteṅ nadī(77) masәh(78) ikaṅ saśleṣma kumlābakәn(79), riṅ smāroṅgva(80) sahiṣṇu(81) nora pinaṅan maṅlih mvaṅ aṅgantuṅa(82), yapvan bheda sakojarojarakәnan(83) maṅke balikniṅ(84) vacan. 4

          3. Drutavilambita:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          gәlana(85) saṅ lagәna n(86) para riṅ sәma(87), vighәna(88) tikṣəṇa(89) yogi ri(90) tulya ya, divadaśeka(91) tuhunya(92) sanirghәna(93), masupәna(94) pva(95) vadhū(96) sumәneha(97) ya. 5

          vagәmi yan(98) paḍәman(99) mahəm iṅ(100) hati(101), tuvi kәleśa(102) vināśa(103) salakṣәmi(104), sәpinikaṅ(105) brata marganikan kәlәm(106), kramaniB2:3rṅ akṣara yan jinajār(107) ika. 6

          3. Pādānuṣṭubh

          lvirniṅ(108) saṁyogaparekī(109), kakyan(110) kakyan kakvan(111) kakvan, kakran anәṅәn(112) aṅgantuṅ(113), kayatnakәn tәmәntәmәn(114). 7

          anta pāda(115) guru yati, kalavan svara(116) kamadhya, dīrghadīrgha(117) vr̥ttavati(118), tāvat(119) guru prasiddha(120) ya. 8

          dīrgha taruṅa(121) surahan(122), visarga(123) lavan ajuṅjuṅ(124), kalavan guru saṁyoga, nahan taṅ sinaṅguh guru. 9

          nihan taṅ svara kamadhya(125), a ā(126) i ī u ū e o(127), tan dadi(128) muṅguh(129) riṅ tәṅah(130), vvītan juga prakr̥tinya(131). 10

          4.

          Aṣṭagaṇa

          4. Vaṁśapatrapatita:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          sampun ikaṅ pratekanikanaṅ(132) guru dinәliṅakәn(133), nyā t ajarәn(134) muvah(135) paduluriṅ guru laghu vuvusәn(136), kvehnya(137) savarga(138) muṅguh ikanaṅ(139) vacan aniganiga(140), yeka sinaṅguhan(141) gaṇa(142) ṅaranya sipatiṅ aṅavi(143). 1

          pūrva nihan(144) makāra(145) ṅaraniṅ guru tiga sagaṇa, lāghu(146) kunaṅ panәṇḍasani luṅguhi yakaragaṇa, yapvan ikaṅ rakāragaṇa(147) lāghu maḍuḍuk(148) i(149) tәṅah(150), hetunikaṅ sakāragaṇa matvaṅ(151) aguru vәkasan. 2

          vruh(152) pva kitā(153) takāra ṅaraniṅ(154) laghu(155) tәpi(156) kavuri, jātinikaṅ(157) jakāragaṇa(158) maṅkana guru ri(159) tṅah(160), bhakti jugaṅ bhakāragaṇa(161) riṅ(162) guru(163) sira rumuhun, nākaragāṇa(164) təlv(165) madulur(166) tika ya laghu(167) paḍa(168). 3

          nya ṅ(169) laghu karva saṅ guru pasəṅgahanika(170) śilalo(171), śeṣanikaṅ(172) gaṇeki(173) vəkasiṅ(174) guru laghu(175) vinuvus, riṅ haji(176) chanda teki yan avās(177) śiva haji(178) piturun, saṅ r̥ṣi vaṁśapatrapatitā(179) sira tiki(180) manata(181). 4

          5.

          Ārya Meter

          5. Jaloddhatagati:  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          nihan gaṇaniṅ(182) ārya(183) yeṅәtakәna(184), jakāra(185) kalavan bhakāra(186) sakara(187), catur laghu(188) guru rva yeka ta lima, ləvihnya(189) guru lāghu(190) kānәm(191) ikahən(192). 1

          lavan hana ta mātra yeṅәtakәna(193), vilaṅnya rikanaṅ(194) sapāda(195) matәtәg, ikaṅ padika(196) pūrvakā tәlu(197) kunaṅ,B1:5v, gənəp rvavəlas(198) aṅgәpanya(199) tuturən(200). 2

          kapiṅ rvanikihәn B2:4r pva(201) ya vvaluvәlas(202), tumut(203) limavәlas(204) padanya(205) vәkasan(206), tan eva taya(207) tāpa tārya(208) vinuvus, samaṅkana vilaṅni(209) matranikihәn. 3

          mvaṅ uṅgvanikanaṅ(210) jakāra(211) matәtәg, kapiṅ rva maṅənəm(212) dvitīya kasulam(213), pada(214) rva(215) ya ta hīṅaniṅ(216) vvaṅ amilaṅ(217), kayatnakәna(218) saṅ vatәk kavivara. 4

          6.

          Words with Retroflex Nasal Ṇa

          6. Kusumāyudha:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          trigaṇa guṇā(219) gaṇita ya guṇitan, prakaraṇa kīraṇa(220) vaṇa karuṇa, aruṇa darūṇa(221) varuṇa śaraṇa, avaraṇa(222) bhāraṇa(223) ṅ apaṇa(224) ṇa gә̄ṅ(225). 1

          6. Praharaṇakalikā:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          guṇa(226) kuṇi kuṇa(227) kaṇvi(228) kaṇikaṇika(229) len, ghraṇa(230) ṅ agaṇagaṇa(231) grahaṇa samiraṇa(232), praṇava vaṇi ya pāṇi ya(233) maṇitaṇitan(234), ayaṇa(235) karuṇa(236) pāṇa(237) ṇa gәṅa(238) yatika. 2

          6. Dodhaka:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          paṇḍita(239) pāṇḍava(240) pāṇḍura pāṇḍu, piṇḍaṅ apiṇḍa(241) mapaṇḍəṅ(242) amaṇḍi(243), laṇḍap alaṇḍәp(244) alaṇḍuṅ aləṇḍə̄(245), gaṇḍi giṇaṇḍi diṇəṇḍa(246) ta ṇāgәṅ(247). 3

          dhāraṇa(248) vāhaṇa(249) vāraṇa(250) bāṇa(251), śrāvaṇa(252) varṇa maṇi(253) kṣaṇa(254) karṇa, arṇava kīrṇa(255) suparṇa(256) yaworṇā(257), cūrṇita(258) pūrṇama ghūrṇita nāgəṅ(259). 4

          6. Pādānuṣṭubh

          kagantuṅa deniṅ ṇa gәṅ(260), ṭa(261) ṭha(262) ḍa(263) ḍha(264) ṇa riṅ ṇa gәṅ(265),B1:6v ta tha da dha(266) na riṅ na lit(267), varṇa doh(268) ya sa(269) savarga. 5
          liṅ saṅ kavi(270) vruh iṅ(271) mārga(272).

          6. Dodhaka:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          uṅgvanikaṅ na lit(273) āpa pakneki(274), ndā(275) savanehnya rikaṅ pakənanya(276), nāta samaṅkana(277) teka(278) na ḍə̄mit(279), kapva masaṅkhya(280) nihan savanehnya. 6

          7.

          Words with Dental Nasal Na

          7. Turidagati:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          muni muna(281) nāna samanuṣa(282), anumana(283) hana(284) naminami(285), dina dhana nādi(286) nada(287) nana(288), hani hina tan hana(289) inituṅ(290). 1

          7. Name unknown (atijagatī class):  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          praṇata natha(291) prajapātini(292) tanu ya(293), tanah(294) atunah(295) pinatattva(296) ta tanaya(297), nita(298) vanitā(299) nininīni(300) tanu tani, mananaB1:7r vanā(301) malinī(302) na lit(303) ikahәn. 2

          7. Pādānuṣṭubh

          vaneh pakәnaniṅ na lit, nāga punnāganiṅ(304) gunuṅ, nāga nāgendra nāgendrī, nāgari nāga nāginī. 3

          magəni(305) yāgni yāgneya(306), gagana(307) dinanān(308) dina(309), ghana vāhana(310) vājinī(311) vāni, nītinitya(312) yanuṅ(313) na lit(314) ika(315). 4

          dahana jvalana vanā(316), kāminī vāhinī nini, punah(317) vinā(318) vani vana, vinavan i na lit ika. 5

          saṅkṣepanya(319) yan vuvusәn, yāvat rakva rəṅva(320) pūrva, pa ba mādi(321) kunaṅ pūrva, dadi na lit(322) dadi ṇa gәṅ(323). 6

          na vyaktanyan huvus(324) kojar, kekadeśanya(325) kokta(326) ya, kocapa teki śa ṣa sa, J2:3v vyaktanya(327) mātra(328) varṇanәnB1:7v. 7

          8.

          Words with Sibilant Śa

          8. Candravartma:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          śambhu śaṅkara śarā śaraṇa śaśī, deśa deśika(329) śaśa ṅ(330) śavala(331) kuśa(332), śvāśucī(333) śuna(334) śirah(335) śiva dr̥śana(336), śānti śoka paśu(337) śāstra(338) śuna(339) śiśu(340). 1

          8. Śikhariṇī:  ⏑  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          śa mūrdhanyātekaṅ(341) śa kurəb(342) umunīṅ(343) vunvunikahәn(344), śaśāṅkāśaṅkhā(345) śaṅkara(346) kuśakuśā(347) keśi kuśika(348), kuśa śrota(349) krośa kraniki katha śabdeṅ(350) śikhariṇī(351), śikhi ṅ(352) keśīkeśā(353) praśa śakuni(354) keśī(355) kuśakuśa(356). 2

          śanaih śūnya śreṇi ghrāṇa piśunane(357) śrīyaśa(358) niśā(359), vināśa(360) mvaṅ(361) māśā(362) daśadiśi śarat(363) śūra raśika(364), śivā(365) śambhuh śūla(366) triśula(367) muśala(368) śrī vava(369) śiva, śavah(370) vaṅśah(371) veśyah(372) śavari śivirākāśa(373) śucimān(374). 3

          9.

          Words with Sibilant Ṣa

          9. Pr̥thvītala:  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          kṣaṇa kṣiṇi(375) kapakṣa lakṣmi viṣayā hahə̄man nidhi(376), kagantuṅa gumantuṅeṅ ṭa ḍa(377) kunaṅ(378) ṣa pr̥thvītala(379), prahr̥ṣṭi(380) parituṣṭa roṣa ruṣa(381) poṣya(382) kr̥ṣṇa(383) proṣa(384), akarṣaṇa(385) ya(386) vr̥ṣṇi(387) vr̥ṣṭa ṣa(388) lumah ṣa pr̥thvītala(389). 1

          maharṣi mahiṣī(390) mahoṣadha(391) maheṣa(392) meṣā muṣa(393), rәṣah(394) muṣika puṣya(395) poṣaka(396) puṣa praṣaṣṭā maṣa(397), ṣaḍaṅguli ṣaḍaṅga(398) bhūṣaṇa(399) subhāṣa(400) durbhāṣita, viṣān(401) uṣadha(402) yauṣadhīṣu(403) viṣama(404) dvipādāsana(405). 2

          bhaviṣyati hiriṣya(406) harṣaṇa(407) puṣā uṣā(408) tyāṣa(409) len, viṣa ṅ(410) viṣaya yomiśeṣa(411) dadi mānuṣā(412) kāṣaya(413), nyataṅ(414) kaluṣa kilviṣa ṅ ayuṣa(415) kaṣmalā(416) doṣa ya(417), nyataṅ(418) mami ṣa yoṅgvaniṅ(419) ṣa(420) marənah(421) riṅ(422) anta ta(423) ya. 3

          9. Sragdhara:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          śākāśa(424) mvaṅ sapr̥thvī(425) sadulur ika rәṅәn yekihәn(426) varṇanәn ta, śuśrūṣā(427) śiṣya(428) śikṣā śviśita(429) vәtunikaṅ(430) mośvasā(431) śeṣaśeṣan(432), śaśvat(433)J1:5v śīrṣanya(434) śośvi(435) śvaṣinaka(436) śaśi(437) de saṅ(438) vasiṣṭhā(439)J3:4v śaviṣṭi(440), maṅkā(441) tekaṅ(442) śaṭhāvor(443) ṣa(444) ta ya tiṅәtiṅәt yeki sākṣāt(445) vәtunya. 4

          10.

          Words with Sibilant Sa

          10. Basantatilakā:  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          māsānikaṅ(446) sa ta nihan vuvusәn padanya, sādhū(447) sadā(448) sata(449) sabhā(450) sisi tāsitāsi(451), sītā(452) susatya(453) rasa satriya(454) sāri(455) saṅ hyaṅ, svecchā(456) svabhāva ri(457) sarasvati(458) sārisāri(459). 1

          samvā(460) savah(461) vasumatī(462) vasusena(463) sūnu(464), mvaṅ(465) ekavāsa(466) hupavāsa(467) vināsavāsa(468), durbhāṣa(469) duryaśana(470) durvyasana(471) praśasta(472), byar(473) śāsa(474) sādhu(475) sasivin sapujinsapūjan(476). 2

          sasvāṅga(477) saṅga(478) sigiB1:9v seṅgita(479) sarga(480) sajja(481), svaṅgah(482) sәga ṅ(483) siga(484) sugih sigaran(485) sagāsor(486), sasvarga sāgara(487) sagorava(488) sādhaka(489) syaṅ(490), rāktosvaniṅ(491) sata(492) sarat(493) pakәnanya(494) sākṣāt. 3

          10. Citrālaya:  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          sura sapta sarah(495) surasa(496) sira sadā(497), samasih(498) papasәn(499) savara(500) suta saha(501), savinaṅ(502) savanәn sakala sakavaśa(503), praja(504) nāmi(505) sa dantya(506) niti(507) kavivara(508). 4

          colophon

          iti paruṅguniṅ(509) akṣara.

          11.

          Sūtrasandhi

          11.1

          nyan sūtrasandhi vuvusәn, parakr̥ta lvirnika(510) pratiṅkahnya, atambayan mavkasan(511), nāhan ta ya(512) sinaṅguhanJ1:6r varṇa.

          l̥(517), yan ta(518) adi samāna(519), tumūt(520) sinama(521), i pūrvaka, vkasan ghoṣa, sahle sah ri(522) svabatәk(523), a i u r̥ l̥(524), lvirnya(525) kavruhana(526).

          12.

          Chanda (Meters)

          12. Pādānuṣṭubh

          Meter Names According to Number of Syllables

          saṅ hyaṅ jagat tripuruṣa(681), namo śivāya(682) ta ṅhulun, amvīt umastava(683) kita, amarṇanā vr̥tta(684) vәtun. 1

          guruniṅ jagat kita ya, mūlākṣara guru laghu,B2:9r mātra āryā(685) ya(686) taṅ gaṇa(687), nāhan ṅaran tataṅ(688) chanda(689). 2

          kita makarūpa chanda, agave titi mvaṅ śloka, ya ta varṇanәn kavətun(690), ya pinakasuluhiṅ(691) rāt(692). 3

          [line 1] lvirniṅ chanda ta ṅaranya, [line 2] kvehiṅ vilaṅniṅ(693) akṣara, [line 3] rikanaṅ pāda(694) sayati, [line 4] pāda(695) ṅaranya sakaṇḍa, [line 5] paB1:13vtaṅ pāda(696) ya(697) saśloka(698).

          mūlanyān keṅәtakəna(699), akṣara tuṅgal iṅ(700) yati, yeka sinaṅguh antyanta, rvaṅ akṣara atyukta ṅa(701). 5

          tryakṣara madhyama nāma(702), pratiṣṭha pataṅ akṣara, śīrṣapratiṣṭha(703) yan lima, nәmaṅ(704) akṣara gāyatrī(705). 6
          Parallels
            śīrṣapratiṣṭha
          • Vr̥t4 Cf. Vr̥t 3.c: tekaṅ supratiṣṭhan lima.

          uṣṇik(706) ri(707) pituṅ akṣara, vvalu pva ya pādānuṣṭubh(708), vr̥hati(709) saṅaṅ akṣara(710), sapuluh pva si pakṣatī(711). 7
          Parallels
            pakṣatī
          • Vr̥t4 Cf. Vr̥t 4.c: yan sapuluh si paṅkti.

          sasambaha(712) pva(713) savәlas(714),J2:6r rvavәlas pva ya(715) jagatī(716), atijagatī(717) tigavlas(718), śakvarī(719) ya(720) padblas(721) ika. 8
          Parallels
            sasambaha
          • Vr̥t4 Cf. Vr̥t 4c: savəlas triṣṭāpa nāmeriya.

          atiśakvarī(722) limavlas(723), aṣṭi nәmbәlas(724) ikahәn(725), atyaṣṭi(726) nahan pituvlas(727), dhr̥ti(728) yapvan(729) vvaluvәlas(730). 9

          atidhr̥ti(731) saṅavəlas(732), rvaṅpuluh ya(733) anukr̥ti(734) kr̥ti(735), prakr̥ti ya ta salikur, rvalikur ikaṅ ākr̥ti. 10

          tәlulikur(736) iṅ(737) vikr̥ti(738), padlikur sunāmakr̥ti, abhikr̥ti(739) limalikur, hana(740) utkr̥ti ṅ(741) nәmlikur.(742)11
          Parallels
            sunāmakr̥ti
          • Vr̥t6 Cf. Vr̥t 6c: yan padlikur saṅskr̥ti.

          12.1

          nahan pratiṅkahnya, sampun ika, samaṅkana vilaṅniṅ vr̥ttiniṅ(743) chanda, yapvan ləvih(744) sakeṅ(745) nәmlikur, daṇḍaka(746) rakva ṅaranya, lvih saṅke rika(747), kalalu ṅaranya, daṇḍaka i ruhurnya(748).

          12. :

          Illustration of Meters on Stanzas

          . Nanda:  ⏓ 

          om̐, na, ndā, stu. 1
          Parallels
            ndā
          • Vr̥t Cf. Vr̥t 9.1–4: a, da, nda, yaṅ.

          . Bhadra:  –  ⏓ 

          sambah, kvāgəṅ, riṅ(817) hyaṅ, bhadra. 2
          Parallels
            bhadra
          • Vr̥t10.1-4 Cf. Vr̥t 10.1-4: devī, gorī, bhadrā, saśrī.

          . Bhadroti:  –  –  ⏓ 

          taṇḍaB1:16rsku, jñānaṅku(818), bhaktyāgәṅ(819), bhadroti(821). (820)3
          Parallels
            bhadroti
          • Vr̥t11.3-4 Cf. Vr̥t 11.3-4: bāṇī śrī, nārī hyaṅ. The name of this meter in CK is bhadroti, while in Vr̥t is nārī.

          . Vanamr̥gī:  –  –  –  ⏓ 

          səkar asәp, paḍanikiṅ(822), vacavacan(823), vanamr̥gī(824). 4
          Parallels
            vanamr̥gī
          • Vr̥t12.3-4 Cf. Vr̥t 12.3-4: cinaru riṅ, vanamṛgī.

          . Vijayanti:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          saṅ(825) hyaṅ akāśa(826), bhūh(827) kiraṇendu(828), agni(829) marut vvai, aum̐(830) vijayanti. 5
          Parallels
            vijayanti
          • Cf. Vr̥t 13.3-4: mvaṅ stutini ṅvaṅ, om̐ aum vijayanti.

          . Tanumadhya:  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          sakveh(831) ta vatәk hyaṅ, muṅgv iṅ(832) navadeśa(833), tonton praṇataṅku(834), muṅgv iṅ tanumadhya. 6

          liṇḍūmara(835) saṅ hyaṅ, ogah kṣiti molah, keṅgək(836)J1:9v vavataṅnya(837), kanyā(838) tanumadhya. [6] 7
          Parallels
            tanumadhya
          • Cf. Vr̥t 14.4: tanyā tanumadhyā.

          . Kusumitagandha:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          sahananikiṅ(839) rat, nara taruB2:11r sattva(840), paḍa ta pinūjeṅ(841), kusumitagandha(842). [7] 8
          Parallels
            kusumitagandha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 15.3-4:ṅuni-uni sakveh, kusumitajanma. It is clear that both CK and Vr̥t show the same pattern of this meter as ⏑⏑⏑|⏑–⏓, but Zoetmulder in Kalangwan (p. 451) incorrectly describe the pattern meter as ⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓.

          . Madhukaralalita:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          mata mulat ahəniṅ(843), damar upamanika(844), vuvus amanis arūm, madhukaralalita. [8] 9
          Parallels
            madhukaralalita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 16.3-4: pahi mara kalavan, madhukaralalita

          . Madalekha:  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          sakvehnya ṅ vatu kambaṅ(845), yeky ānuṅ(846) pamujāṅku(847), kleśālvāṅa(848) phalanya, naṣṭāniṅ madalekha(849). [9] 10
          Parallels
            madalekha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 17.4: ronya lvir madaleka.

          . Kumāralalita:  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          tlas(850) ta ṅhulun(851) amūjā(852), niroga huna(853) vighna, phalaṅkv(854) anuku(855) śāla(856), kumāralalitātvaṅ(857). [10] 11
          Parallels
            kumāralalita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 18.3-4 maṅgih yan cacadən ṅvaṅ kumāralalitāsvi.

          . Vatāpathyā:

          nahan(858) sambahkva(859) riṅ deva, karūhun(860) riṅ(861) munīvāra(862), amītāmarṇanājñāna(863), vatāpathyātəhər(864) vtunya(865). [11] 12
          Parallels
            vatāpathya
          • Cf. Vr̥t 20.3-4: atut tan tṛṣṇa riṅ jīva, savetniṅ lāra patya ya.

          . Pādānuṣṭubh

          sakvehniṅ pada yan pathya, kālapa laghuṅ(866) akṣara, pāda(867) kapiṅrva(868)B1:17r kapiṅpat, pādānuṣṭup(869) lvirniṅ laku(870). [12] 13

          . Śāpantika:  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓  /  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          āpan(871) ya tika(872) linәvih(873), jñānāhayu(874) lavan(875) ulah, pūjā(876) satata(877) tan alum, śāpantika(878) lagi-lagin. [13] 14
          Parallels
            śāpantika
          • Cf. Vr̥t 32.4 : śāpantikāliṅi mulat. However, the meter pattern of śāpantika in CK and Vr̥t is slightly different. In CK, śāpantika is presented as ––⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t it is presented as ––⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓.

          . Vitana:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          lvirnikanaṅ hayu(879) lagi(880), yeki(881) dәlә̄n(882) tuladana(883), śobha(884) vənaṅ(885) saparana, divyaB2:11v kadi pva(886) vitana. [14] 15
          Parallels
            vitana
          • Cf. Vr̥t 33.4 : pakṣi vitāna sukādyus. In Vr̥t, the name of this meter is vitāna. The metric pattern is also slightly different in both CK and Vr̥t. In CK, vitana is presented as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t vitāna has patterns as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|–⏓.

          . Māṇavakakrīḍita:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          yapvan ulah(887) lāgi(888) tivas, hayva ginәṅ(889) bvat hantukan(890), doṣanikāmrih(891) kasulam(892), māṇavakakrīḍita(893) ya. [15] 16
          Parallels
            māṇavakakrīḍita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 31.3-4 : tusnya kinəmbəṅ madaləm, māṇavakākrīḍitaka.

          . Vidyutmālā:  –  –  –  |  –  –  –  |  –  ⏓ 

          ayva(894) ṅvaṅ tan pamrih yatna, akveh lvirniṅ maṅde duhkha, yāvat(895) kevat śabdanteṅ len, tāvat(896) mr̥tyū(897) vidyutmālā(898). [16] 17
          Parallels
            vidyutmālā
          • Cf. Vr̥t 34.4 : kumlab himpər vidyutmālā.

          . Bhramaravilambita:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          apan(899) ika saṅ vihikan, tan alupa riṅ pitutur, naga ta taman(900) gigirәn, bhramaravilambita ya. [18] 18
          Parallels
            bhramaravilambita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 35.3-4 : kusuma kataṅga sumār, bhramaravilambita ya.

          . Bhujagaśiśukr̥ta:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏓ 

          saphalakəna(901) huripniṅvaṅ, magavaya(902) hayu sambega, ya taṅ usir anurāgeṅ(903) rat(904), bhujagaśiśukr̥tāgurva. [21] 19
          Parallels
            bhujagaśiśukr̥ta
          • Cf. Vr̥t 36.3-4 : kanigara vuṅu lentañjuṅ, bhujagaśiśusr̥tā puṣpa. On the meters’ list of CK, the name of this meter is bhujaṅgasukr̥ta.

          . Ayamukha:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          hayva vākparuṣa(905) capala, yekaṅ abhyasa kaviratin, byakta moha puharanika, doparanyanaṅ(906) ayamukha. [22] 20
          Parallels
            ayamukha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 37.4 : yan tinon kadi halamukī.

          . Turidagati:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          ya tikana vastuniṅ avərə̄(907), ikaṅ avamāna(908) puja(909) jəvah(910), gərəmə təbəṅ(911) manmu(912) sukha(913), turidagatinya varəg upet(915). [23] (914) 21
          Parallels
            turidagati
          • Cf. Vr̥t 40.4 : hananasibū tvaritagati. All CK evidences present clearly turidagati as the name for the 10-syllable meter (paṅkti) with the pattern |⏑–⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏓. Turidagati is most likely the indigenous name of the Sanskrit meter tvaritagati, which may be due to a misreading of the name, which also occurred with other meter names (cf. ayamukha instead of halamukhī). It is unclear whether this misreading occurred in the early adoption of the Sanskrit prosody to Javanese tradition or rather in the middle of a later transmission process. In Kalangwan (1974), Zoetmulder (1974: 113, 465) put turidagati as the name for the 22-syllable meter (ākr̥ti) which has the pattern ⏑⏑⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑–⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑ –|⏑–⏑|⏓. However, it is still unclear from which source Zoetmulder took turidagati as the name for the first meter of ākr̥ti category. In fact, he himself still doubted his own decision regarding the name. Although it is still uncertain, a number of editions, e.g. Śivarātrikalpa (Teeuw, 1969), Kuñjarakarṇa Dharmakathana (Teeuw, 1981) and Arjunavivāha (Wiryamartana, 1990; Robson, 2008) describe the ākr̥ti meter with that pattern as turidagati. Therefore, the mention of turidagati in the whole CK evidences clarifies that turidagati could be another name for tvaritagati which is included in the paṅkti category, not ākr̥ti. The other problem then raises with regard to the name of the metre from the latest category, which should be discussed.

          . Ambək śuddha:  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          sakvehniṅB2:12r sukhaduhkha(916) tan madoh, petən keriṅ avak lavan manah(917), nāhan(918) hetuni saṅ(919) mahāmuni, ambək śuddha pineti(920) saṅ mahan(921). [24] 22
          Parallels
            ambək śuddha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 41.4 : byaktaṅ śuddhavirāt pilih sisik

          . Rukmavatī:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          deyanikā(922) saṅ sañjñana(923) buddhi(924), saṅsara mahyun(925) riṅ(926) sukha vāhya, mamrih amūjā(927) sādhaka(928) riṅ(929) hyaṅ, rukmavatī(930) sādhyanya(931) sadāśrī(932). [26] 23
          Parallels
            rukmavatī
          • Cf. Vr̥t 42.4 : rukmavatī lvirniṅ raṇu denya. In the list of meters in CK, sadhanaśrī is its proper name, not rukmavatī.

          . Pavana:  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏓ 

          āpan(933) saṅ sukha tuməmuṅ(934) prihnya, vvaṅ vīdagdha(935) ya rasikā(936) ṅūni(937), bhaktī(938) hyaṅ kr̥tayaśa tan seṅ vvaṅ(939), gəṅniṅ(940) puṇya(941) pavana yānuntun(942). [27] 24
          Parallels
            pavana
          • Cf. Vr̥t 43.4 : śabdanyākr̥panavaṅiṅ megha. In the list of meters in CK, particularly in ms. J2 given that the other textual evidences are omitted, anuntun is its proper name, not pavana. However, it may be appropriate to take pavana to be a metathesis of paṇava.

          . Jayendrabajra:  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          lvirniṅ dadi(943) vvīt(944) ikanā(945) jatinya(946), maṅgəh gavenyan paripūrṇa(947) janma, hetunya mamrih magave(948) parārtha(949), rapvan(950) təmuṅ(951) vīrya(952) jayendrabajra(953). [28] 25
          Parallels
            jayendrabajra
          • Cf. Vr̥t 44.4 : svecānucuk padma kadīndrabajra.

          . Upendrabajra:  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          ikaṅ kavīryan(954) kalavan(955) sukhāgə̄ṅ(956), kapaṇḍitan dibya ləvih(957) rikiṅ rat, asiṅ sakojarnira tan kapāpa, upendrabajropama(958) taṅ sulābha(959). [29] 26
          Parallels
            upendrabajra
          • Cf. Vr̥t 45.4 : tvasasmu sinyuh riṅ upendrabajra.

          . Upasthita:  ⏓  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          svajātiniṅ(960) rat maharəp kavīryan, paḍāṅajap(961) bhyūdaya(962) len sukhāgəṅ(963), manah jugāhyun(964) tama(965) tan paratra(966), upasthitādoh(967) ri(968) sudharma(969) saṅ hyaṅ. [30] 27
          Parallels
            upasthita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 46.4 : tenṅgal kitopasthita}he prənahku. In CK, upasthita has the same pattern with upendrabajra or upendravajrā, which may be stated that upasthita is another indigenous name of upendravajrā (at least in the CK). However, upasthita mentioned in Vr̥t deals with different rule of pattern than what is described in CK. The first and the third verse-line accomplish the pattern ⏑–⏑|––⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏓ belonging to upendrabajrā, while the second and the fourth has the pattern of jayendrabajra or indravajrā (––⏑|––⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏓). That is clear that upasthita has the same pattern rule as the upajāti meter from Sanskrit tradition, which combines upendravajrā and indravajrā meters. Therefore, it seems to be more reasonable to take upasthita as the indigenous name of upajāti, although the CK does not provide jayendrabajra’s pattern in upasthita.

          . Dodhaka:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          jātinikaṅ(970) vvaṅ agəṅ mada(971) moha, kevala buddhi(972) taman vruh i sornya(973), tan sakayāsiga(974) caṅkak-acaṅkak, dodhaka(975) duhkha(976) magəṅ(977) tinəmunya(978). [31] 28
          Parallels
            dodhaka
          • Cf. Vr̥t 48 : śīghra ḍaṭəṅ kadi dodakavr̥tta.

          . Salisir:  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          nā lvirniṅ vvaṅ hīnayonī(979) haneṅ(980) rat, bheda(981) mvaṅ saṅ puṇya(982) mvaṅ(983) devayoni(984), vīryā(985) māsan rūpavān lūd(986) paneṣṭin, siṅ solahnyan(988) sālisir(989) tan pavarṇa. [32] (987)29
          Parallels
            salisir
          • Cf. Vr̥t 49.4 : sugyan śokāśā linipteṅ laronəṅ.

          . Vimala:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          dūra pvekaṅ(990) mada(991) moha ṅ apə̄pa(992), maṅkin humvat kasujanmannirāvan(993), kendran ta kweh(994) kalivat yan(995) kabhukti, svecchā(996) riṅ rāt sthira tovin vimāla(997). [33] 30
          Parallels
            vimala
          • Cf. Vr̥t 50.4 : ṅkāneṅ toya drutavātormmimāla.

          . Bhramaravilasita:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          yogya ṅvaṅ mabhyasa(998) sukha(999) viratin, atyantevəh ri(1000) vənaṅa(1001) kuśala, śabdantārum kusuma paḍanika, devāṅrəṅva(1003) bhramaravilasita. [34] (1002) 31
          Parallels
            bhramaravilasita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 47.4 : lvir sambatniṅ bhramaravilaśita.

          . Svāgatā:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          mas maṇik juga viśeṣa rikiṅ(1004) rat, ndan(1005) ləvih(1006) təmən(1007) ikaṅ(1008) kasuśīlan(1009), buddhi(1010) paṇḍita lavan(1011) hupaśānta, svāgateṅ(1012) para taṅan matalaṅkup(1013). [35] 32
          Parallels
            svāgatā
          • Cf. Vr̥t 53.4 : svāgatāvəlasi rohta kasihyun.

          . Rathoddhatā:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          saṅ narendra sira mībək iṅ(1014) jagat, tar vənaṅ(1015) haṅupakāra saṅ(1016) viku, byaktaniṅ kaviratin(1017) maharddhika(1018), yāmr̥tāsuṅa(1019) vənaṅ(1020) rathoddhatā(1021). [36] 33
          Parallels
            rathoddhatā
          • Cf. Vr̥t 52.4 : lot ratoddhata gatinta tanbəsur}.

          . Madhugulāmr̥ta:

          kiraṇa pinakasuluh iṅ loka, vulan amuhara śukhaniṅ cittaJ2:8v, sakala kiraṇa hati saṅ prajña, vuvusira ya madhugulāmr̥tta(1022). [37] 34

          • Cf. Vr̥t 54.4 : nda tan akalibaki tatāvr̥tta.

          . Bhikṣuka:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          yeka mārganiṅ anəmvakən(1023) hayu(1024), saṅ vənaṅ(1025) makadulur hajəṅnira(1026), nīti(1027) nāga ta sirān tameṅ gita(1028), srūni(1029) cihnani manah kabhikṣukan. [38] 35
          Parallels
            bhikṣuka
          • Based on its pattern, bhikṣuka is clearly the other name of rathoddhatā.

          . Drutavilambita:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          paṅan inum(1030) si turū(1031) sukhaniṅ dadi, viṣaya(1032) rāga tumut ya lavan(1033) tuha, si tuha yeka tinūt tikanaṅ(1034) pati, drutavilambita(1035) janma punah-punah. [39] 36
          Parallels
            drutavilambita
          • Cf. Vr̥t 57.4 : drutavilambita yan pagave lara.

          . Vaṁśastha:  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          nahan tinon(1036) saṅ viku(1037) niścayeṅ pati(1038), dumeh sirāmrih(1039) maṅusī(1040) guhā gunuṅ, avak pinucchāpan(1041) avas hilaṅnika(1042), kadi(1043) pva(1044) vaṅśastha(1045) sirāmuḍhāṅhina(1046) hina(1047). 37
          Parallels
            vaṅśastha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 56.4 : satoyavaṅśastha masuṅ srəpi manah.

          . Toṭaka:  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          manaḍah(1048) ta gaṅan hatatāmirasa(1049), virasa(1050) ndan aveh(1051) sukhacitta(1052) rasa, rasaniṅ mahurip(1053) ya katon rinasan(1054), rasamātra(1055) ya toṭaka(1056) tulya(1057) kilat. 38
          Parallels
            toṭaka
          • Cf. Vr̥t 58.4 : kuṅikāvətu toṭakagītarasa. The meter vīralalita in the list of CK have not been ilustrated yet. Or, it may be the other name of toṭaka?

          . Rasanetra:  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          paṅgaga paṅpuṅ, paṅgaga(1058) petən, paṇḍula tulya, riṅ(1059) rasanetra(1060). [42] 39

          . Śrīpuṭa:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          tuhu mata(1061) ya sukhenak bhoganiṅ(1062) rat(1063), ri(1064) tutuk ika tan aṅgəh(1065) tuṣṭa riṅ(1066) heṅ, viṣaya si tama(1067) humvat rāga(1068) rāga(1069) vr̥ddhi(1070), riṅ avasana katr̥ṣṇan śrīpuṭāśā(1071). [43] 40

          ləhəB1:21rṅ atikā(1072) saṅ parahita(1073) buddhi, mayaśa(1074) sinambyan(1075) maṅuluy i dharma(1076), mati(1077) mahurip(1078) kastavanira laṅgəṅ(1079), sira ta pinūjeṅ(1080) kusumavicitra(1081). [45] 41

          • Cf. Vr̥t 59.4 : apulaṅavor mvaṅ kusumavicitra.

          . Bhujaṅgaprayatna:  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          pəjah pveka(1082) saṅ(1083) vus lanā(1084) puṇya riṅ(1085) rat, umantuk sireṅ svargaloka(1086)B2:14r hyaṅ indra, yayan bhāvacakra(1087) ndan(1088) olih salambvan(1089), ləhəṅ(1090) saṅka ri(1091) crol(1092) bhujaṅgaprayatna(1093). [48] 42
          Parallels

          • Cf. Vr̥t 62.4: bhramanteṅ taman lvir bhujaṅgaprayāta.

          . Bhramitākṣara:  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          aparan kunaṅ phalanikaṅ(1094) kuhaka, inalәm(1095) tahāsukha(1096) madoh mata(1097) ya, śata janma-janma(1098) saparanya cәmәr, bhramitākṣaranya(1099) saparanya tivas. [49] 43
          Parallels
            bhramitākṣara
          • Cf. Vr̥t 65.4 : bhramitākṣarāmuya mulatiṅ kalaṅən.

          . Vaiśvadevī:  –  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          hetunyan prihәn taṅ ulah(1100) sādhubuddhi(1101), āpan(1102) vyartha tāpa(1103) suśīla(1104) vruheriṅ(1105), siṅ ṅvaṅ(1106) sādhv(1107) atambәha(1108) riṅ rāmareṇa(1109), maṅkā(1110) strī(1111) ya(1112) satya ya taṅ(1113) vaiśvadevī(1114). [50](1115) 44
          Parallels

          • Cf. Vr̥t 63.4 : śobhāṅ māhantən vaiśvadevy aṅgaluntaṅ.

          . Turagagati:  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          dvaniṅ(1116) vvaṅ ahurip śaraṇagata(1117), mareṅ(1118) agati sarva(1119) kasih(1120) arәp, yapvan(1121) vәnaṅa sāma(1122) tapasana(1123), lәhәṅ matәmahan(1124) turagagati(1125). [85],45

          . Navamālinī:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          syapa(1126) sira tan paṅastava(1127) suśīla(1128), matuha(1129) rare paḍa vruh ika(1130) tan sor, kunaṅ(1131) ivәh iṅ(1132) vәnaṅ(1133) praṇata(1134) bhakti(1135), kadi navamālinī(1136) jugani(1137) sojar. [51] 46
          Parallels
            navamālinī
          • Cf. Vr̥t 64.4 : abhinavamālinī tilatilamnya.

          . Kusumapadānta:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          mataṅ ikaB1:22rB2:14v saṅ vruh(1138) gumagap ikaṅ(1139) me-(1140), -vәh anumaneṅ rat(1141) ṅuni-ṅuniṅāpuṅ-(1142), -guṅ(1143) apan(1144) ikaṅ(1145) vruh(1146) mavara-varah(1147) doh(1148), bhaya tan(1149) asiṅ vvaṅ(1150) kusumapadānta(1151). [52] 47
          Parallels
            kusumapadānta
          • Based on its pattern, kusumapadānta is clearly the other name of kusumavicitra in stanza 41.

          . Praharṣiṇī:  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          lvirniṅ(1152) vvaṅ(1153) varas agәlәm(1154) lanā(1155) vinasvas, vruh mojar riṅ(1156) alara tan tahekaṅ(1157) evәh(1158), vvaṅ prajñā(1159) sugih aṅajap jugul(1160) daridra(1161), mevәh(1162) ṅvaṅ maṅanumata(1163) praharṣiṇī(1164)J1:12v len. [53] 48
          Parallels
            praharṣiṇī
          • Cf. Vr̥t 67.4 : sāsiṅ rāmya mamuhara prahārṣiṇī tvas.

          . Rucirā:  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏓ 

          ya hetu saṅ vruha kulamitra gәṅ taha(1165), uṣādha(1166) tapva hinanakәn(1167) pasaṅgrahan(1168), ivәhnikiṅ(1169) giṇa mahurip(1170) sadāsukha(1171), nahan(1172) katon surucira(1173) snāha(1174) sādhana(1175).B1:22v [54](1176),49
          Parallels
            rucira
          • Cf. Vr̥t 68.4 : ləyəplaṅə̄nika rucirāṅuṅaṅ lurah. Its name in the list of CK is śasadana.

          . Mattamayūrā:  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          tan mevәh(1177) lvirniṅ(1178) yaśa de saṅ(1179) karuṇeṅ(1180) rat(1181), vvat(1182) vve(1183) sәṇḍaṅ(1184) śāla(1185) vihārāśrama(1186) bodhi(1187), pәh(1188) mantra mvaṅ(1189) taṅ guligā(1190) kāyaśa(1191) donya(1192), kasyāsihniṅ mattamayūrā(1193) ta(1194) kiniṅkin(1195). [55] 50
          Parallels
            mattamayūrā
          • Cf. Vr̥t 70.4 : kagyatdeniṅ śabda nikaṅ mattamayūra.

          . Sambaddha:  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏓ 

          sugyekā(1196) saṅ vruh halәpakәna(1197) kinatvāṅan(1198), āpan(1199) śuddhāmbәknira(1200) kadi variṅinB2:15r māvan(1201), mībək kaṅ(1202) rat(1203) kapva(1204) ta sihira tәkeṅ(1205) sattva(1206), puñcakniṅ(1207) crol(1208) ṅvaṅ gumavaya sira(1209) sambaddha(1210). [56] 51

          . Maṇiguṇanikara:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓  /  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          syapaB1:23v tan atakuta mulati(1249) munivara, tәkap(1250) i samahita ya kadi gunuṅ apuy(1251), brata japa(1252) ginәlarira(1253) mamәnuhi(1254) rat(1255),B2:15r kalana kәḍik ika(1256) maṇiguṇanikara(1257). [59] 55
          Parallels
            maṇiguṇanikara
          • Cf. Vr̥t 77.4 : suka maṇi guṇanikaranika yanimaləm. It should be noted that maṇiguṇanikara described in CK has 14 syllables, while those which is provided in Vr̥t has 15 syllables. In Sanskrit, those 15 syllables maṇiguṇanikara are called śaśikalā.

          . Mālinī:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          sahana-hananikeṅ rat(1258) rakva(1259) tan vyarthabhakti(1260), ri yativara nihan tādeṅkva(1261) namyātalaṅkup(1262), sakaharәpira(1263) siddhābhakti(1264) riṅ(1265) hyaṅ paḍātvaṅ(1266), malakaluṣanireṅ jro mālinī(1267) nāma(1268) kumlāb. [60] 56

            mālinī
          • Cf. Vr̥t 78.4 : mamuharaha sihiṅ janmālinipteṅ laronəṅ.

          . Mr̥dukaralalita:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  –  ⏓ 

          sakveh tāmrih(1269) mataki-taki(1270) kasantoṣan lvāmbәk, ayva(1271) prajñan kativas ika(1272) tan aṅgan(1273) korurva(1274), puṅguṅ gə̄ṅən(1275) tivas ati kalәlәb(1276) maṅkin kleśa(1277), yogyāṅambәk(1278) mr̥dukaralalitā(1279) gә̄gә̄ntāmrih(1280). [62] 57

          . Kuvalayakusuma:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  ⏓  /  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  –  ⏓ 

          vvaṅ(1281) nīca(1282) mitra sujana sakarәṅ(1283) buddhinyātut(1284), tan maṅga(1285) yan paḍa(1286) sujana paḍa(1287) crol satyātūt(1288), sojarny atūt(1289) silihiraṅ(1290) aṅasihan yāpāṅguṣṭha(1291), kumbaṅ(1292) lavan kuvalayakusuma(1293) lvirnyan meriṅ(1294). [63] 58
          Parallels
            kuvalayakusuma
          • Cf. Vr̥t 72.4 : madhyanyāñjrah kuvalayakusumanya mrikmar. The meter kuvalayakusuma in the Vr̥t has the 14 syllables whose the short-long patterns are identical with madhyakṣāmā in Sanskrit while the CK has the 15 syllables of kuvalayakusuma.

          . Giriśa:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          munivara sira satyeṅ(1295) sādhyāṅarcana(1296) satata(1297), tan alupa(1298) satatāmrih-mrih(1299) śuddhabrata(1300) ginәgə̄(1301), mavaraṇa(1302) sukhaniṅ(1303) rat(1304) sih saṅ hyaṅ tulusa masih, brata(1305) tapas i(1306) samādhī(1307) nityā(1308) sevana giriśa(1309). [44] 59

          . Kusumāyudha:  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          ya ta(1310) satataṅ(1311) hayu(1312) tinaki-taki(1313), hilaṅanikaṅ(1314) daśamala(1315) madana(1316), ya juga sudhīramatta(1317) ya linagan, kadi kusumāyudha(1318) maṅani(1319) hati(1320). [64] 60

          . Bhujagavilasita:  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ 

          nda nahan(1321) vighәnaniṅ(1322) agave(1323) tapabrata(1324) lanā(1325) marupuhi ri hati(1326), ya kadә̄hanәnira(1327) taṅ adә̄h(1328) lanā(1329) ri vәṅi(1330) yātika(1331) kinatuturan, niyatā(1332) manahira magavay(1333) hala n tulakaniṅ(1334) japa samadhi(1335) lanā(1336), apan ākara(1337)B1:24v hima masukī(1338) ta saṅ munivarā(1339) bhujagavilasita(1340).           . Citralekhā:  –  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          solahniṅ saṅ vvaṅ(1369) hala hayu(1370) katon denikaṅ(1371) saṅ vidagdha(1372), sāmbәkniṅ saṅ vvaṅ juga(1373) katәpәtan(1374) denikā(1375) saṅ praveśa(1376),B2:17r sojarniṅ saṅ vvaṅ juga(1377) karuhunan denikā(1378) saṅ huvus vruh, ṅkānan(1379) hyaṅ sākṣat hatinira(1380) hibәk(1381) citralekhe(1382) sisinya(1383). [46] 64
          Parallels
            citralekha
          • Cf. Vr̥t 87.4 : lāvan tekā lothiniliṅiliṅan citralekanta lambaṅ. All corpus of CK provide citralekha in the illustration as a meter having 17 syllables whose the pattern is identical as mandākrānta. However, I have to take a position to emend the citralekha as a distinctive meter compared to mandākrānta. The problem could be the missing of a long syllable at the beginning of each line.

          . Mandākrāntā:  –  –  –  –  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  –  ⏑  –  ⏓ 

          yāvat(1384) pva vvaṅ(1385) vruh(1386) umajarakәn denikā(1387) bhāvabhaṅga(1388), ambәk mohāṅayam-ayam(1389) inak(1390) buddhi(1391) santoṣa(1392) yan adoh(1393), vruh tapvā(1394) yan vruh(1395) umujarakәn(1396) sojar iṅ(1397) pustakāji(1398), mandākrāntā(1399) jvalana(1400) siṅ adūmona kāpan>(1401) mapuṅguṅ(1402).           12. :

          Kakavin

          kṣamakәna(1938) matike(1939) vuvusniṅ hulun ndah kamuṅ(1940) hyaṅ ya sakveh(1941) ta sūkṣmāganal(1942) muṅgu riṅ(1943), deśa deśāntare(1944) sor iṅ(1945) ūrdhah(1946) lavan madya(1947) deśātmakāniṅ(1948) jagat lyab sakālanta(1949) devāṣṭamūrti(1950) pratiṣṭhanta(1951) sākṣāt(1952) rәṅə̄(1953) ta kṣamāniṅ(1954) hulun svastha(1955) dīrghāyuṣāmaṅguh(1956) enak(1957) sadāyovanā(1958),1
          ṅuniṅuni ta mahāmunī(1959) saṅ vәnaṅ(1960) meh kaniśśreyaśān iṅ(1961) liṅiṅ(1962) saṅ(1963) kavī paṇḍita mvaṅ(1964) ta(1965) saṅ vagmi riṅ tattvavīt iṅ(1966) vatәk vāla(1967) vidyā(1968) laB1:32rvan saṅ mahāsajjanārәmba(1969) riṅ(1970) dharma(1971) kāryenak ambәk(1972) yaśa(1973) sih(1974) lavan dāna(1975) puṇya(1976) praṇamyaṅku tonәn(1977) rәṅə̄(1978) ta stutiṅkun(1979) vruhante katuṣṭiṅku(1980) bhaktyādalәm(1981),
          tәka(1982) ri pusupusuhku(1983) sumsum hutәk(1984) tvas(1985) dagiṅ rahku sakvehny(1986) avakniṅ(1987) ṅhulun(1988) bhakti riṅ(1989) vāhyavāhyaṅ(1990) kulәm sārisāri(1991) praṇātā(1992) satāta(1993) pradiptojvalāmbәkku(1994) tan pāntarāṅūsapiṅ(1995) jə̄ṅ(1996) mañiptālanā(1997) tvaṅ(1998) magәṅ prastavanyan(1999) vәnaṅ(2000) marṇanā(2001) jñāna(2002) saṅ paṇḍitāṅusvakәn(2003) kottaman(2004) saṅ(2005) tapaḥsiddha(2006) yogīśvarātūt(2007) tutur hetuka, vuṅuvuṅu(2009) śatapattra(2010) tuñjuṅ hijo(2011) dhūpa(2012) dīpārcanā(2013) śaṅkha(2014) ghaṇṭā(2015) satātaṅ(2016) sәkar(2017) rәb(2018) rinok riṅ(2019) jәnuṅ(2020) vr̥tti(2021) sāteja(2022) nāhan ta simpәnnikiṅ(2023) kavya(2024) kābhyāsa(2025) saṅ(2026) hyaṅ kachandan(2027) ya vargāsәkar(2028) tanJ3:13v kәnālum(2029) pamūjāṅku(2030) muṅgv iṅ(2031) rikaṅ(2032) daṇḍakā(2033) chanda(2034) nāhan(2035) ta vr̥ṣṭi(2036) prayatna(2037) stutīniṅ(2038) hulun(2039) riṅ vatәk(2040) devatā(2041) · [104],(2008)

          atha(2043) sampun(2044) ikaṅ(2045) guru lāghu(2046) lavan gaṇa(2047) mātra(2048) yatinya(2049) padanya(2050) suchanda(2051) mavr̥tta(2052) matūt(2053) marikān(2054)pinarākr̥ta(2055) denika saṅ kavi dāśanamāṅanumāna(2056) ri saṅ maharәp(2057) vruha riṅ paribhāṣa(2058) kavīśvara(2059) kavya ṅaran kiraṇa pva ya(2060) donanikānaṅ(2061) atirvana(2062) yan paṅәne(2063) matikā(2064) pinarah(2065) tәkәnanta(2066) mareṅ(2067) kavi dibya nihan ya(2068) vaneh kunәṅ utpәnaniṅ(2069) hulun akṣamakәn ta(2070) tәmәn(2071) matikeṅ(2072) ayu lon(2073) sahananta(2074) mahājana(2075) siṅ sira(2076) mahyuna tāsisinahv(2077) aṅusir(2078) tikanaṅ(2079) rasa(2080) gīta(2081) kavyanira(2082) saṅ(2083) rahatiṅ(2084) parapet(2085) rusit(2086) iṅ paribhāṣa(2087) maran(2088) saphalātiśayanta(2089) katon satirun(2090) sigәgәn(2091) ta rәṅə̄n(2092) sapujin(2093) matikin(2094) prihәniṅ(2095) magave(2096) yaśa(2097) devata(2098) yoni ṅaranya vәnaṅ(2099) kavinәn(2100) tuhu(2101) buddhi(2102) mahan(2103) kadi ḍaṇḍaka(2104) nāma(2105) malāhati(2106) yojvala(2107) lə̄ṅnya(2108) madәg · \\\par,(2042) 2

          pәṅpәṅ(2109) teku hurip(2110) tatāmriha(2111) tapāṅuratana(2112) kavikun(2113) palar(2114) biṣa(2115), ayvāṅgə̄ṅ(2116) yaśa vīrya(2117) śāstra(2118) kavilәt(2119) ṅvaṅ ika kasamayā(2120) punarbhava(2121), tonton duhkhanikiṅ(2122) dadi(2123) vvaṅ adulur prihati(2124) kasakitan(2125) mamet sukha(2126), aṅriṅkәl(2127) viṣayanya(2128) pan pinakavāśanika(2129) vulat(2130) ananta(2131) tan tirun. 3

          posikniṅ(2132) prih(2133) anūtakәn(2134) brata samādhi(2135) karaṇani(2136) ḍatәṅ(2137)nikaṅ(2138) sukha(2139), tan saṅkeṅ(2140) kaluṣā(2141) lәmәh(2142) palәpalәh(2143) karukaru(2144) kuhakāptiniṅ(2145) turu(2146), yadyan papraṅ avikva(2147) tovi madagaṅ(2148) tan(2149) upirupir ikan(2150) tәkeṅ(2151) tәkan(2152), pūjā(2153) mvaṅ(2154) vyavasāya(2155) taṅhi(2156) pinakāśrayanira(2157) ri katәmvaniṅ hayu(2158). 4

          syapa sira(2159) mahyun vihikana(2160) mojar, tamakәna(2161) taṅ chanda(2162) ginava(2163) denya, huvus(2164) apagәh(2165) denta tumamakәnya, niyata biṣantāṅucapucap(2166) enak. 5

          colophon

          iti(2167) vr̥tta(2168) samāpta(2169) · \

          om. B1 B2
          This line is absent in the Balinese mss. It is hard to determine if the absence there is due to omission in the course of transmission, or vice versa, where an interpolation has taken place in the Javanese transmission (for which only J2 is available here).          sujanātiharṣa B1 B2
          sujanādi harṣa J2          irikaṅ J2
          ruməṅə̄ B1ruməṅə B2
          Since harṣa ruməṅə̄ is a rather frequently occurring phrase in OJ literature, I consider it likely that the B recension replaced an authorial reading irikaṅ preserved in J2.          kavruhi B1
          kavruhī J2vruhi B2          laghu lavan tekā em.
          laghu lavan tikā J2om. B1 B2          bhedanyaṅ B1
          bhaiddhāniṅ J2bedanyaṅ B2          lāghu J2
          lagu B1 B2          huṅgvaniṅ hakṣara J2
          uṅgvaniṅ akṣara B1 B2
          I retain the initial h on both words from the Javanese ms., because the spelling of the Balinese mss. would yield an unmetrical sequence.          yeriṅәn J2 B2
          yariṅәn B1          hila-hilekā J2
          ila-ileka B1 B2          kasthānan norm.
          kāsvanan J2kāsthanan B1kastanan B2
          See J1 20v1–2 ndā lvirnya, AIUEO, hilahila hikaṁ bharaṁ kasthanan. Fill in cross-reference once that passage has been edited.          bhyaktāniṅ guru sarva J2
          om. B1 B2          dīrgha norm.

          Interestingly, that the word apaṇa in this text seems to be a metanalysis of apāna "one of five vital airs (pañcabāyu)". Or, it could be an adopted Sanskrit word from āpaṇa "market" as ms. B2 mentionned, but this word is not recorded yet on OJED and not acceptable in metri causa.          ṇa gә̄ṅ B1

          Both paṇḍita and paṇḍapa are acceptable in reading. However, the use of word paṇḍapa instead of maṇḍapa indicated that Balinese mss. tradition is more recent than Javanese ms.          pāṇḍava norm.

          This emendation is based on two reasons: (1) the words in this line are correlationg with any moving object (ghana, vāhana) and its characteristic (vāni); and (2) the word vāhinī is mentionned just in the next stanza.          nītinitya norm.

          Both puṣya and puṣpa are acceptable for the reading. It seems that the Balinese scribes considered that the word puṣpa is missing on the list, so that the reason they added this word.          poṣaka em.

          bhaviṣya B1 B2
          According to the OJED, the Sanskrit word īrṣyā has many metanalysis in Old-Javanese such as īrṣya, ariṣya, hīrṣya, irisya. That is why the word hiriṣya in this reading might be acceptable.          harṣaṇa em.

          It is interesting that the word satriya here is highly used in Middle and Modern Javanese. In the other hand, the word satiru in the Balinese mss. is not proper word with sibilant sa, which is actually the prefix.           sāri J1 J2 B2

          It is interesting that the name of this meter in Vr̥t is alamukha, not ayamukha. This critical edition does not consider the latest as a best reading due to that form ayamukha is consistent written in all CK mss.          ambək śuddha norm.

          Cf. Vr̥t 32.4 : śāpantikāliṅi mulat. However, the meter pattern of śāpantika in CK and Vr̥t is slightly different. In CK, śāpantika is presented as ––⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t it is presented as ––⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓.          hayu J1 J2 B2
          ayu B1          lagi J1 B1 B2

          yeka J2          dәlә̄n norm.

          tuladhana J1 J2          śobha B1 B2
          soṅa J1 J2          vənaṅ norm.
          vnaṅ J1 J2 B1          kadi pva J1 B1 B2
          khadī pya J2          vitana
          Cf. Vr̥t 33.4 : pakṣi vitāna sukādyus. In Vr̥t, the name of this meter is vitāna. The metric pattern is also slightly different in both CK and Vr̥t. In CK, vitana is presented as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑⏓, while in Vr̥t vitāna has patterns as –⏑⏑|–⏑⏑|–⏓.          ulah J1 B1 B2

          rāt B1 B2          bhujagaśiśukr̥ta
          Cf. Vr̥t 36.3-4 : kanigara vuṅu lentañjuṅ, bhujagaśiśusr̥tā puṣpa. On the meters’ list of CK, the name of this meter is bhujaṅgasukr̥ta.          vākparuṣa B2
          vakparuṣa J2 B1          doparanyanaṅ J2

          Cf. Vr̥t 37.4 : yan tinon kadi halamukī.          avərə̄ B1
          avərə J2 B2          avamāna B2
          avamana B1āvamāṇa J2          puja J2
          puji B1 B2          jəvah B1 B2
          jīva J2          gərəmə təbəṅ J2
          gərəmətən hiṅ B1gərəmətən ṅhiṅ B2          manmu norm.
          manmu J2 B1          sukha norm.
          suka B1śuka J2          upet B2
          upīt J2upə̄t B1          turidagati
          Cf. Vr̥t 40.4 : hananasibū tvaritagati. All CK evidences present clearly turidagati as the name for the 10-syllable meter (paṅkti) with the pattern |⏑–⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏓. Turidagati is most likely the indigenous name of the Sanskrit meter tvaritagati, which may be due to a misreading of the name, which also occurred with other meter names (cf. ayamukha instead of halamukhī). It is unclear whether this misreading occurred in the early adoption of the Sanskrit prosody to Javanese tradition or rather in the middle of a later transmission process. In Kalangwan (1974), Zoetmulder (1974: 113, 465) put turidagati as the name for the 22-syllable meter (ākr̥ti) which has the pattern ⏑⏑⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏑⏑|⏑–⏑|⏑⏑⏑|⏑ –|⏑–⏑|⏓. However, it is still unclear from which source Zoetmulder took turidagati as the name for the first meter of ākr̥ti category. In fact, he himself still doubted his own decision regarding the name. Although it is still uncertain, a number of editions, e.g. Śivarātrikalpa (Teeuw, 1969), Kuñjarakarṇa Dharmakathana (Teeuw, 1981) and Arjunavivāha (Wiryamartana, 1990; Robson, 2008) describe the ākr̥ti meter with that pattern as turidagati. Therefore, the mention of turidagati in the whole CK evidences clarifies that turidagati could be another name for tvaritagati which is included in the paṅkti category, not ākr̥ti. The other problem then raises with regard to the name of the metre from the latest category, which should be discussed.          sukhaduhkha norm.
          sukaduhka B1 B2śukaduhka J2          lavan manah J2

          suka gəṅ J2sukāgəṅ B1 B2          jugāhyun B1 B2
          juga hyun J2          tama J2
          tamā B1 B2          paratra J2
          parārtha B1parārta B2          upasthitādoh norm.
          upasvikādoh J2upasṭitādoh B1umasvitādoh B2          ri J2 B1
          riṅ B2          sudharma B2
          sadharma J2suḍarma B1          upasthita
          Cf. Vr̥t 46.4 : tenṅgal kitopasthita}he prənahku. In CK, upasthita has the same pattern with upendrabajra or upendravajrā, which may be stated that upasthita is another indigenous name of upendravajrā (at least in the CK). However, upasthita mentioned in Vr̥t deals with different rule of pattern than what is described in CK. The first and the third verse-line accomplish the pattern ⏑–⏑|––⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏓ belonging to upendrabajrā, while the second and the fourth has the pattern of jayendrabajra or indravajrā (––⏑|––⏑|⏑–⏑|–⏓). That is clear that upasthita has the same pattern rule as the upajāti meter from Sanskrit tradition, which combines upendravajrā and indravajrā meters. Therefore, it seems to be more reasonable to take upasthita as the indigenous name of upajāti, although the CK does not provide jayendrabajra’s pattern in upasthita.          jātinikaṅ J2

          citralitī J2citraliti J3citralika B1citralike B1          sisinya B1 B2
          śīṣīnya J2śiṣinya J3          citralekha
          Cf. Vr̥t 87.4 : lāvan tekā lothiniliṅiliṅan citralekanta lambaṅ. All corpus of CK provide citralekha in the illustration as a meter having 17 syllables whose the pattern is identical as mandākrānta. However, I have to take a position to emend the citralekha as a distinctive meter compared to mandākrānta. The problem could be the missing of a long syllable at the beginning of each line.          yāvat J2

          Le B1 se termine dans cette partie.          tәlulikur […] nәmlikur.
          pādānuṣṭup irrégulière          duvәg […]
          Le J1 a réécrit la strophe || 61 || comme suit: nda nahan vignaniṅ agavai tapa brata laṇā marupuhi ri hati, ya kadhә̄hanira ya maṅaḍī laṇā ri vṅi yā tika kinatuturan, niyāta manahira magavaiy tahan tulakniṅ japa samaḍi laṇa, / apan ākara hima maśa kīta saṅ munivarā bhujaga vilaśiha ·; mais je ne l’ai pas inclus dans l’édition car les trois autres manuscrits ne l’ont pas réécrit.          rāgantāgә̄ṅ […] anakәbini
          Cette strophe entière est omise dans le #msba.          śivapattra…hana ta
          An omission intervenes in B1          aparājita…avitana
          An omission intervenes in B1 B2           […] .

          Unmetrical. The pattern of the lines is  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  –  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  –  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏓ .           […] ,
          Unmetrical. The pattern of the lines is  –  ⏑  ⏑  |  –  ⏑  ⏑  |  –  ⏑  (  ⏓  )  |  –  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  –  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  ⏑  –  ⏑  |  –  ⏑  ⏓ .           […] [104],
          Unmetrical. The pattern of the lines is  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ⏑  ⏑  ⏑  |  ‖  –  ⏑  –  ‖ .          atha […] \\\par,
          Unmetrical. The pattern of the lines is  ‖  ⏑  ⏑  –  ‖ .

          Apparatus

          ^31. mvaṅ laku śloka nihan len] J2, om. B1 B2 • This line is absent in the Balinese mss. It is hard to determine if the absence there is due to omission in the course of transmission, or vice versa, where an interpolation has taken place in the Javanese transmission (for which only J2 is available here).

          ^224. ṅ apaṇa] B1, hapaṇa J2, ṅāpaṇa B2 • Interestingly, that the word apaṇa in this text seems to be a metanalysis of apāna "one of five vital airs (pañcabāyu)". Or, it could be an adopted Sanskrit word from āpaṇa "market" as ms. B2 mentionned, but this word is not recorded yet on OJED and not acceptable in metri causa.

          ^406. hiriṣya] J1 J2 J2, bhaviṣya B1 B2 • According to the OJED, the Sanskrit word īrṣyā has many metanalysis in Old-Javanese such as īrṣya, ariṣya, hīrṣya, irisya. That is why the word hiriṣya in this reading might be acceptable.

          ^1678. bratāśvalalita] B1, bratāṅ śvalalita J1, brataśyalalita J2, brataśvalalita J3
          ^1679. duvәg […] ] Le J1 a réécrit la strophe || 61 || comme suit: nda nahan vignaniṅ agavai tapa brata laṇā marupuhi ri hati, ya kadhә̄hanira ya maṅaḍī laṇā ri vṅi yā tika kinatuturan, niyāta manahira magavaiy tahan tulakniṅ japa samaḍi laṇa, / apan ākara hima maśa kīta saṅ munivarā bhujaga vilaśiha ·; mais je ne l’ai pas inclus dans l’édition car les trois autres manuscrits ne l’ont pas réécrit.
          ^1680. ayvātah] J1, ayvata J2, ayvatā J3, om. B1
          ^1681. sakte] J3, śakte J1 J2, om. B1
          ^1682. bhoga] J1 J2, boga J3, om. B1
          ^1683. pavәkasaṅ] norm., pavkasaṅ J1 J2 J3, om. B1
          ^1684. nindā] em., nindrā J1, nidra J2, nīdrā J3, om. B1
